meanings.definition: The state or condition of being geographically separated from others of the same species.
meanings.sent1: Allopatry can lead to the development of distinct species over time.
meanings.sent2: The allopatry of the two bird populations resulted in different mating behaviors.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's allopatry from its relatives made it the loneliest critter in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The allopatry between the two islands created unique ecosystems on each.
meanings.sent5: The concept of allopatry helps us understand how isolation influences evolution.

meanings.definition: The occurrence of populations of the same species in separate geographical areas.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study allopatry to learn about the distribution of species.
meanings.sent2: Allopatry can result from natural barriers like mountains or rivers.
meanings.sent3: The zoo's accidental allopatry of the monkeys and lemurs led to unexpected interactions.
meanings.sent4: The allopatry of the fish populations allowed for different adaptations to develop.
meanings.sent5: Allopatry plays a crucial role in speciation and biodiversity.
